intro: Bursera panamensis, commonly known as Panama birch, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees. The plant is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are arranged alternately along the branches. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. Bursera panamensis is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions.
